Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning of Miyazawa’s life at the beginning of the Showa period and the ending at the beginning of World War II. It is a story of a man who strongly held to his ideals against weakness, sins, business and consumerism in his daily life.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat (Ginga) stopping anyone going near the family.
